active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs between performance overhead and security benefits of encrypting east-west traffic in a high-scale microservices environment. Use real-world examples from cloud-native deployments and reference NIST CSF guidelines to support your arguments.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Security Architecture and Engineering. Topic: 'East-West Traffic Unencrypted' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > Application Architecture Vulnerabilities > Microservices Architecture Weaknesses > East-West Traffic Unencrypted). Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list above]. Target cards across Bloom's levels. - Active Learning: Infuse hooks from discussion/peer teaching/problem-solving into explanations. - Scaffolding: Distribute cards: 25% Layer 1, 25% Layer 2, 25% Layer 3, 25% Layer 4. - Research Context: East-west (internal) vs north-south (external) traffic; risks (insider threats, malware); mitigations (micro-segmentation, NIST CSF Protect); microservices focus. Follow Flashcard Schema exactly: [insert full schema above] Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, e.g., [ { "front": "Question?", "back": { "correct_answer": "Answer.", "explanation": "Detailed...", "distractors": ["A", "B", "C"], "bloom_level": "Understand", "scaffolding_layer": 2, "tags": ["Cybersecurity", "East-West Traffic Unencrypted"] } } ]. Ensure variety: 40% Remember/Understand, 30% Apply/Analyze, 30% Evaluate/Create. High-quality, exam-ready (CISSP-style).
